header:
The U.S. Copyright Office (USCO) recently released Part 2 of its three-part report on artificial intelligence (AI) and copyright, addressing the copyrightability of works created using generative AI. Published on January 29, 2025, this report reinforces the principle that human authorship is essential for copyright protection under U.S. law. Below are the key points from the report:

Human Authorship as a Core Requirement
Works entirely generated by AI without meaningful human input are not eligible for copyright protection. This aligns with long-standing principles of U.S. copyright law, which protect only original works created by humans.

epochEvents.name: Part 3 expected at end of year
